Rush Limbaugh has said: "It has not been proven that nicotine is addictive, the same with cigarettes causing emphysema [and other diseases]." (Radio show, 4/29/94) Do you agree?
 
 http://www.youdebate.com/DEBATES/rush_nicotine.HTM
I believe that it is addictive. I dont believe all that other bull, like smoking killing people, or harming pregnant women's unborn babies.

WHAT???? You don't believe that smoking causes lung cancer or causes premature and low birthweight in babies???? Why on earth not? There are only 5000 studies on each that tell me otherwise. Why wouldn't you believe that? Even without studies it is painfully apparent. You think that people who smoke just HAPPEN to get emphasyema 85% more often than non-smokers?

Sorry, low birth weight yes, but it doesn't do anything else! don't let me get technical about the pregnancy thing!
 people who dont smoke get lung cancer and emphasyema.

Yeah, just like people who don't jump off of skyscrapers get broken bones, but I guarantee that the broken bone rate in people who jump off syscrapers is higher than those who don't, just like the emphysema/lung cancer rate is undeniably andastronomically higher in those who smoke than those who don't. 
 
 I really mean no offense by this, but I honestly thought that there was not 1 person in America who did not believe the side effects of smoking were legitimate. Do you smoke, is this denial or wishful thinking?? The facts and proofs are there, it really truly is undeniable. And yes low birth rate, doesn't sound like much until you read the studies that show that children with low birth rates usually have learning disabilities...not to mention that whole dying thing when you weigh to little.

LOL , There are no facts proving that the death, or learning disabilities, of children came from smoking.
 When a women is pregnant, they have a fluid inside of them (amneyotic fluid) (i know its not spelled right.) and when they smoke it reduces the amneyotic fluid, which causes low birthweight. They would have to smoke about 20 cigarettes at a time really fast all day long for the fluid to disapear and cause any damage to the baby.

No but there are facts that 65% of children who are over a pound underwieght develop a significant learning disability. Now let's follow this huge, complicated chain, you can do it. Smoking causes underweight babies ---< babies who are born underweight have a much higher chance of infantile death and learning disabilities, therefore.....follow?....smoking causes learning disablities in children. 
 
 And don't you dare say that children whose parents don't smoke get learning disabilities. Or I quit.

What % of the 65% of underweight babies, had smoking mothers?
 I dont want you to quit so I wont say it. lol

i swear, some people are soooooo stupid. anyone with a tiny bit of sense knows that smoking is harmful. its almost not even worth debating with ignorant people like you about such a non-disputed topic

Almost evey single one I know who has had a baby, smoked through the pregnancy. There kids are fine.
 I'm sure if we took cigarette smoking out of this the statistics would not change on the percentage of children with learning disabilities.
i know as a fact that alcohol is very very very harmful for a baby when inside the womb. will you admit though that smoking causes cancer???
Ban it all! Ban it all! Oh, here come the angry posts...

Well, I didnt say anything about alcohol.
 
its almost not even worth debating with ignorant people like you about such a non-disputed topic
 
 I thought I was too ignorant and not worth a debate?

OK, o no one ever said that every parent who smoked had an underwieght child (and apparently we should change the national studies because Sara has 4 friends whose children turned out "just fine")...the fact remains that the a much more likely to have an underweight child and that an underwieght child is much more likely to have learning disabilities. So no it is not 100%...but are you willing to take that risk??? I personally say that it is not your decision to smoke during pregnancy, and any mother who smokes during pregnancy, doesn't have the willpower or even care enough to quit shouldn't have a child. Why risk your child being permanantly disabled because some uncaring mother can't stop her stupid habit for 9 months. 
 
 And what on earth is ROTFL...whatever.

It means Rolling On Floor Laughing.
 I do smoke, and I myself believe that when you are ready to have a baby you should stay away from it. I know it is unhealthy.
 I get your point,, smoking, more likely to have low birthweight
 low birthweight, more likely to have a problem. My questin is.....What percentage of the children who have learning disabilities, who were underweight, had a smoking mother?
 If it is more than 30% Ill agree with you.

Maternal Smoking has been linked to 20-30% of all low birth weight babies in the United States. http://www.co.missoula.mt.us/measures/BirthWt.htm
 
 And here is what low birth weight does to a child.
 http://www.modimes.org/professionals/681_1153.asp
Now do you honestly believe that smoking does not cause a host of cancers and emphysema? Or are you just comforting yourself?

Moreover, maternal smoking during pregnancy is not associated with either congenital defects nor preterm births. In fact, the preterm and low birthweight infants of maternal smokers have a better survival rate than those born to nonsmokers. This phenomenon is primarily due to the lower incidence of infant respiratory distress syndrome [RDS] among the babies of smokers. RDS is a frequent cause of death for premature babies.
 
 http://66.221.20.150/evidence/hamilton/mat-smok/file2.htm
 http://66.221.20.150/forum/files/preg.htm
 http://www.lcolby.com/b-chap8.htm
 http://www.lcolby.com/b-chap10.htm
 http://www.lcolby.com/b-chap12.htm
 http://www.lcolby.com/b-chap13.htm
 Geez, what a migrain!My head hurts from all that reading, Falling!
 Try to read chptr13 before chapter12, it will help you out.

you are in denial. i can tell that you are a smoker because you are desperatly searching for sites that say smoking is not bad for you. then let me ask you a question...why is it that 99.9% of doctors say smoking causes cancer?
Where did you get that percentage from?
This is basically denying those chemicals aren't present... and they are.
emoticon_confused If it is not addictive, why is it that those who wish to quit smoking, have such a difficult time. In fact many never succeed.emoticon_frazzled

Where did you get that percentage from?

 
 68% of percentages are made up!

emoticon_confused If it is not addictive, why is it that those who wish to quit smoking, have such a difficult time. In fact many never succeed.emoticon_frazzled

 
 I've succeeded in quitting smoking...three times!
 
 My personal experience says it's highly addictive, both psychologically and physically.
